fish, bred by Canadian researchers at Aqua Bounty Farms near New Brunswick, are endowed with foreign genes that produce growth hormones and reach market size of about seven pounds in about 18 months, or twice as fast as normal salmon; researchers describe fast-growing fish as part of blue revolution in aqua-culture that could feed more people more efficiently and cheaply, but critics fear genetically engineered fish could slip through porous net of federal regulations, posing serious environmental threats; fish are barged for 36-hour, 300-mile trip, bypassing dams on Snake River and Columbia River; now Army Corps of Engineers is considering whether to breach dams to restore healthy salmon runs; such action is bitterly opposed by many as assault on Washington State's agricultural economy; river's coho salmon has been declared extinct, and all other species of Snake River salmon and steelhead are listed under Endangerd Species Act; photos; map (M)")('2000050', 'Wendy Wartes letter says gay people who discuss their issues with marriage on television must have great courage')('2000050', 'Hostage-taking in southern Philippines reflects lawless world of pirates, smugglers and warlords, where kidnapping for ransom is business and religious wars are fought by throwing bombs into markets and churches; paleoanthropologists hail discovery as major advance in their field, saying skulls are probably most ancient undisputed human fossils outside Africa; international discovery team, led by Dr Leo Gabunia of Georgia National Academy of Sciences, concludes that age of skeletal characteristics of skulls links them to early human species Homo ergaster, who lived from 1.9 million to 1.4 million years ago and who some researchers think is African version of Homo erectus; latest findings contradict theory that human ancestors left Africa soon after they invented better stone axes and other tools of what archaeologists call Acheulean culture; 1,000 stone tools found near two skull are all pre-Acheulean; this could mean that it was not technology, but biology or environment, that set human ancestors off on their migrations; maps (M)')('2000051', 'Holland Cotter reviews work of several Latino artists at De Burgos Cultural Center (S)')('2000051', "Mayor Giuliani holds news conference, at which he deals with questions about his health, marital problems and possible withdrawal from Senate race;
